artifact.content: UC 1: Administrator Logs into System Event: Administrator logs into the System Console. A user name and password are provided. System: The server controlling the Telephone Exchange System. Actors: System Administrator(initiator), administrator�s terminal Overview: This use case captures the process of the administrator logging into the System Console. The administrator will provide a user name and password, and if they are correct, then the system will let the administrator access it.

UC 2: Add a New User Event: The administrator adds a new user account to the system. The user data is an input. System: The server controlling the Telephone Exchange System. Actor: Administrator (initiator), administrator�s terminal Overview: When a user is added to the system, an administrator must find an unassigned phone number, an available IP address, and associate the phone number with the IP address.

UC 3: Assigning User a Phone Number to IP Mapping Event: The administrator assigns a user a phone number which is mapped to an IP address. This event requires the user, a unique phone number, and a unique IP address. System: The server controlling the Telephone Exchange System. Actor: The administrator (initiator), the administrator�s terminal Overview: The administrator adds an unassigned phone number and an available IP address to a user account, and associates the phone number with the IP address

UC 4: Validate Phone Number Event: Administrator checks that a specific phone number has not been mapped. System: The server controlling the Telephone Exchange System. Actors: The administrator (initiator), administrator�s terminal. Overview: The user requests a specific phone number for their account. The administrator validates that the number is available before mapping it to the IP and user.

UC 5: Assigning User Privileges Event: Administrator assigns a user some combination of phone privileges. This event accepts the targeted user and the desired privileges as inputs. System: The server controlling the Telephone Exchange System. Actors: the administrator (initiator), administrator�s terminal Overview: The administrator can assign a user with some combination of the following privileges: originate calls, receive calls.

UC 6: Administrator Suspends User�s Account Event: Administrator chooses to suspend user�s account. System: The server controlling the Telephone Exchange System. Actors: The administrator (initiator), administrator�s terminal. Overview: This use case captures the process of suspending a user�s account, be it because of a hardware malfunction or a user�s request

UC 7: Administrator Reactivates User�s Account Event: Administrator chooses to reactivate user�s account. System: The server controlling the Telephone Exchange System. Actors: The administrator (initiator), administrator�s terminal Overview: This use case captures the process of reactivating a user�s account

UC 8: Cancel A User�s Service Event: The user decides to unsubscribe from the telephone service. The administrator needs to know the user�s name. System: The server controlling the Telephone Exchange System. Actors: The administrator, the administrator�s terminal Overview: The administrator dissociates the phone number and IP from the user�s file. This is done because the user decided to end the service

UC 9: Administrator Conducts Hardware Tests Event: The administrator initiates hardware tests. It is to be conducted whenever a user complains about the service. System: The server controlling the Telephone Exchange System. Actors: The administrator (initiator), the administrator�s terminal Overview: The Administrator requests that tests be conducted to ensure that the system is functioning properly.

UC 10: Display Hardware Information Event: The administrator checks that all the hardware is fully functional. System: The server controlling the Telephone Exchange System. Actors: The administrator (initiator), the administrator�s terminal Overview: Periodically, the administrator needs to check that the VoIP system is functioning properly. If errors are detected, the administrator must fix it.

UC 11: Set Maximum Number of Calls on the System Event: The load of the system is set. A number for the load is required. System: The server controlling the Telephone Exchange System. Actors: The administrator (initiator), the administrator�s terminal Overview: The administrator sets the number of calls that the system can handle at once. This number changes based on added resources or customer complaints.

UC 12: Search for User Event: The administrator chooses to search for a specific user. The user name is needed for this event to occur. System: The server controlling the Telephone Exchange System. Actors: The administrator (initiator), the administrator�s terminal Overview: In the main screen of the system console, a search function will be available to the administrator to search for a specific user by first and/or last name. It will filter out the matching user names in a list. It is assumed that the administrator is already logged into the system

UC 13: Automated Hardware Diagnostic Test Event: Hardware diagnostic tests will automatically run every x seconds. System: The server controlling the Telephone Exchange System. Actors: Time (initiator), phone Overview: This is a check that the phone is operating normally. If there is a resource leakage, the resource will be released. When the error has been fixed, the phone will be available again.

UC 14: Administrator Views User Bill Event: Administrator chooses to view user bill. System: The server controlling the Telephone Exchange System. Actors: The administrator (initiator), administrator�s terminal. Overview: This use case captures the process of the administrator viewing a user�s bill.

UC 15: Administrator Records Bill Payment Event: Administrator chooses to record user�s bill payment. System: The server controlling the Telephone Exchange System. Actors: The administrator (initiator), administrator�s terminal. Overview: This use case captures the process of the administrator recording a bill payment into the system.

UC 16: Automatic Bill Generation Event: Server generates a monthly bill and sends it to customer. System: The server controlling the Telephone Exchange System. Actors: Time (initiator). Overview: This use case captures the process of the server automatically generating a user�s bill and sending it to the user.

UC 17: Print Bill Event: Administrator wants to print a user�s bill. System: The server controlling the Telephone Exchange System. Actors: The administrator (initiator), administrator�s terminal. Overview: The administrator needs a bill printed and they system prints one.

UC 18: Administrator Registers New Billing Plan Event: Administrator chooses to register new billing plan. System: The server controlling the Telephone Exchange System. Actors: The administrator (initiator), administrator�s terminal. Overview: This use case captures the process of the administrator creating and registering a new billing plan.

UC 19: Administrator Modifies Billing Plan Event: Administrator chooses to modify billing plan. System: The server controlling the Telephone Exchange System. Actors: The administrator (initiator), administrator�s terminal. Overview: This use case captures the process of the administrator modifying an already existing billing plan.

UC 20: Administrator Deletes Existing Billing Plan Event: Administrator chooses to delete an existing billing plan. System: System Console that controls the VoIP system Actors: The administrator (initiator), administrator�s terminal. Overview: This use case captures the process of the administrator deleting an existing billing plan.

UC 21: Administrator Subscribing Billing Plan to User Event: Administrator chooses to attach billing plan to user. System: The server controlling the Telephone Exchange System. Actors: The administrator (initiator), administrator�s terminal. Overview: This use case captures the process of the administrator subscribing a billing plan to a user.

UC 22: User Places a Phone Call Event: User decides to make a phone call to another user of telephone exchange system. System: The server controlling the Telephone Exchange System. Actors: Caller (initiator). Overview: This use case captures the process of one user making a phone call to another user.

UC 23: User Receives a Phone Call Event: User receives a phone call from another user of telephone exchange system. System: The server controlling the Telephone Exchange System. Actors: Caller (initiator), Callee. Overview: This use case captures the process of one user receiving a phone call from another user.

UC 24: User Hangs Up Phone Event: User ends a phone call by hanging up. System: The server controlling the Telephone Exchange System. Actors: Caller (initiator), Callee. Overview: This use case captures the process of a user ending a phone call by hanging up.

UC 25: View Administrator Accounts Event: The administrator wishes to view the system�s other administrator accounts. System: The server controlling the Telephone Exchange System. Actors: The administrator (initiator), the administrator�s terminal Overview: The administrator opens the �Administrator�s Account� module of the system

UC 26: Change Administrator Password Event: The administrator changes his/her login password. System: The server controlling the Telephone Exchange System. Actors: The administrator (initiator), the administrator�s terminal Overview: The administrator can change his/her password. He/She must supply the old password, the new password.

UC 27: Add New Administrator Account Event: The administrator adds a new administrator account. System: The server controlling the Telephone Exchange System. Actors: The administrator (initiator), the administrator�s terminal Overview: The administrator can add a new administrator account by providing a new username and password.

UC 28: Remove Administrator Account Event: The administrator removes an existing administrator account. System: The server controlling the Telephone Exchange System. Actors: The administrator (initiator), the administrator�s terminal Overview: The administrator can remove the account of an existing administrator.

UC 29: Enable An IP Phone Event: The IP phone has been fixed. System: System Console that controls the VoIP system. Actors: The administrator, the administrator�s terminal Overview: The IP Phone was disabled due to errors. Since it has been fixed, the phone is enabled again and resources are reallocated.

UC 30: Disable An IP Phone Event: The physical phone is broken or the software on the phone is erroneous, leading to resource leakage. System: System Console that controls the VoIP system. Actors: The administrator, the administrator�s terminal Overview: There is a problem with the phone and it is disabled to save resources.
